questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are managing a Microsoft Teams environment. You assign Audio Conferencing licenses to users. You configure a bridge number for the audio-conferencing bridge.
The audio-conferencing bridge number does not appear in meeting invitations that users create by using Microsoft Outlook.
You need to provision a new conferencing bridge number.
Which five actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
The answer is incorrect. The correct values are:
Acquire and assign a service number to the conferencing bridge
Configure default and alternate languages for the conferencing bridge
Configure conference bridge settings
Assign dial-in phone numbers for users who load meetings.
Schedule a meeting by using Outlook
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-audio-conferencing-in-teams
When you enable a user for audio conferencing, by default they are sent emails that include conferencing information and their PIN

I agree.. Last point should be "schedule a meeting"
Step 6: Set your conferencing bridge settings - This is where you can change the PIN if required. 

The Team Admin can change the PIN for the user or the user can go to https://dialin.teams.microsoft.com/usp to reset the PIN - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/reset-the-audio-conferencing-pin-in-teams#reset-a-users-pin

Step 1: Find out if Audio Conferencing is available in your country/region
Step 2: Get and assign licenses
Step 3: Get service numbers for your conferencing bridges
Step 4: Assign a service number to the conferencing bridge
Step 5: Set the default and alternate languages for a conferencing bridge
Step 6: Set your conferencing bridge settings
Step 7: Assign dial-in phone numbers for users who lead meetings
Step 8: Set up meeting invitations (optional)

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/set-up-audio-conferencing-in-teams#step-2-get-and-assign-licenses
Last point should be "Schedule a meeting"
Yes, there is no need to change the bridge PIN after associating a conference bridge number. Hence the last point should be "Schedule a meeting“
Last point is „Schedule a meeting“ and not change PIN

Selected Answer: B
Correct.
The suggested solution is "Assign a calling policy that has an emergency address for each user".
A calling policy controls which calling and call forwarding features are available to users whereas an Emergency policy (aka Emergency calling policy" is using to control what happens when a user in your organization makes an emergency call.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/voice-and-calling-policies
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/configure-dynamic-emergency-calling
Calling policy does not have an emergency address lol
did you noticed that:"You need to ensure that the address for the new location is available to emergency responders" only in Q5

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A ExamTopics company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
The company has a main office in one region. The company opens a new office in another region. You must relocate 400 users to the new office.
You need to ensure that the address for the new location is available to emergency responders.
Solution: Assign a calling policy that has an emergency address for each user.
Does the solution meet the goal?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A ExamTopics company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
The company has a main office in one region. The company opens a new office in another region. You must relocate 400 users to the new office.
Solution: Create a configuration profile with the emergency address and assign the profile to the device for each user.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct
Emergency calling policies are assigned to users and network sites and not devices
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-emergency-calling-policies

Also, configuration profile has to do with Company conference phones.
<Control and manage Teams certified phones across your organization, create and upload configuration profiles for each type of phone you have, make changes to their settings>
Emergency address/location is not attached to a device. its part of physical street of a place of business. lol

TAC -> Locations -> Add -> New Emergency Address. This sure looks like a configuration profile to me. In the Policy you can define Places (such as floors or rooms within the specified address), Phone Numbers (to assign the configuration?) and sections to configure Subnets, Wi-Fi access points, switches and ports.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
A ExamTopics company has a Microsoft 365 subscription.
The company has a main office in one region. The company opens a new office in another region. You must relocate 400 users to the new office.
Solution: Add an emergency address and then modify the outbound calling settings for each user.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Outbound call settings have nothing to do with emergency calling policies

Selected Answer: A
Correct
Emergency Calling policies can be assigned to users and network sites.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/MicrosoftTeams/manage-emergency-calling-policies

Correct Answer is A
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/troubleshoot-microsoft-teams-voice-issues/3-understand-emergency-calling-issues?ns-enrollment-type=LearningPath&ns-enrollment-id=learn.wwl.troubleshoot-microsoft-365-teams

Selected Answer: A
On the Edit pane, under Emergency location, do one of the following:

To assign an emergency location, search for, and select an emergency location.

To change the emergency location that's already assigned to the user, click X to remove the existing location, and then search for and select the location you want to assign.

comments.content: Never mind. I take it back.

REALLY? you looking at Audio Conferencing settings - Dial out permission from A meeting. 
Nothing to do with Outbound calling. Please check your work.
I agree. Outbound calling has nothing to do with it. The first portion is correct, but the second portion is incorrect

discussion.content: Within the Outbound Calling user settings in the TAC, you can only select the following options, Any Destination, In the same country or region as the organiser or Don't Allow. As this option has nothing to do with Emergency Location settings, I would say this wrong.

Selected Answer: ABC
Correct
Screen sharing diagnostic data is contained in the media logs (blog log files). Media logging is turned on by default for some computers based on CPU but endusers must make sure the media logs is turned on.

Oh ya, media logging is off by default.

Enjoy~
Correct~

Selected Answer: ABC
To collect Media logs for Mac:

The files will be available in the following locations:
~/Library/Application Support/Microsoft/Teams/media-stack\\\*\.blog
~/Library/Application Support/Microsoft/Teams/skylib\\\*\.blog

Selected Answer: ABC
The answer is correct. Check the "Media Logs" section in the article https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/log-files

Pretty sure the answer is wrong.
1: Enable Media Logging as it's off by default so needs to be turned on.
2: On a mac, Collect Logs by pressing Option + Command + Shift +1

I'm not a Mac person so have no idea about the other logs, the article cited only talks about Linux.

choices.B: Turn on media logging and restart the Teams app.
choices.D: Use the keyboard shortcut: Option + Command + Shift + 1 and review files at the location ~/Downloads.

questions.question_text:
A user sets up a Microsoft Teams meeting on a device that runs macOS.
The user reports that they are disconnected from calls and meetings when they start sharing content.
You need to export the media logs to investigate the issue.
Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE:
Each correct selection is worth one point.
